meanings.definition: Having a crest or tuft on the head.
meanings.sent1: The pileated woodpecker had a striking red crest on its head.
meanings.sent2: The pileated rooster proudly displayed its colorful tuft.
meanings.sent3: The pileated squirrel sported a fashionable tuft on its head.
meanings.sent4: Her pileated hairstyle resembled a regal crest.
meanings.sent5: The pileated bird's crest was as vibrant as a sunset.

meanings.sent3: The pileated toys were stacked in a messy heap in the room.
meanings.sent4: The pileated books on the shelf looked like a tower of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The pileated snow outside made a soft heap for jumping.

meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of piles.
meanings.sent1: The pileated bridge was made of sturdy wooden piles.
meanings.sent2: The pileated dock was built with strong piles to support boats.
meanings.sent3: The pileated house had a unique foundation of wooden piles.
meanings.sent4: The pileated fence surrounded the garden with tall wooden piles.
meanings.sent5: The pileated structure stood firm on its foundation of wooden piles.
